Understate: The claim may understate the level of bipartisan support for the DREAM Act by referring to it as "strong bipartisan support" when in fact it only received support from a small number of Republicans.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to substantiate the statement of "strong bipartisan support" for the DREAM Act.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the DREAM Act failed despite strong bipartisan support, when in fact it failed to garner enough votes for cloture, falling just five votes short.
